p: Notwithstanding the diversity of the absolute and relative importance of agriculture emissions, recent scenario analyses indicate that reductions in agricultural emissions will be important for meeting ambitious global climate goals of limiting warming to 1.5 or 2 °C above pre-industrial levels (Reisinger et al. 2013; Gernaat et al. 2015; Wollenberg et al. 2016). Therefore, the Paris Agreement has put the agricultural sector back into focus when it comes to the fine-tuning of how countries achieve their overall emission reduction targets.
